CatDescriptText: Mrs. Anne Kenderson, sales clerk, Bellevue and Miss Doris Cromie, sales clerk, Garfield, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 26, 1962, pg. 8 with question: "Should better medical care be provided for the aged through Social Security?" Anne Kenderson's answer reads: "I think so.  Sometimes when a person grows old, they don't have sufficient income, so some help is needed from somewhere."  Miss Doris Cromie's answer reads: "Yes, for the simple reason that you don't have money when you grow old and sick and sombody has to take care of you."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Anne Kenderson wearing three quarter sleeve dress, holding handbag over right arm, standing on corner of intersection with Specialty Luggage in background, Downtown; Portrait of Doris Cromie wearing plaid short sleeve dress, standing on sidewalk next to telephone pole at intersection with Bar B Q and Specialty Luggage in background, Downtown
